Show HN: A website builder that you can recommend to your family
text:
I've seen a lot of posts about personal blogs and RSS lately. Reading all the comments here on HN, I was constantly thinking "yes, this is what I offer with Hey Homepage".

So now seems like a good time to introduce the Hey Homepage website builder and it's functions. Plus the fact that now everybody can start a FREE website. Whether you use it as a microblog, a webshop, an info site, a photobook, an RSS reader, etc.

Hey Homepage offers: - Design it yourself - by finetuning the different style elements, by easily picking one of the preset styles, or by quickly throwing random colors together - Responsive layout - works on desktops, tablets and smartphones - Create content - pages, texts, images, videos, products, blogposts, timeline posts, etc. - Visitor stats - internetfriendly visitor stats; without tracking people and no annoying cookie banners - Forms - flexible forms you create yourself; to use as a contactform, a signup form, a request form, etc. - Shop - sell physical goods, digital files, or service appointments; get paid by IBAN, Paypal or Bitcoin - Blog - write longform content, about whatever you like - RSS (Really Social Sites) - a microblog, a timeline with feed, a built-in RSS reader, shared links; the web is already social media!

Come try it out, it's free and it's fun!

P.S. Hey Homepage can be free, because we make money with a premium offer of the website builder and our design services for devs.

title: Ask HN: Are Data Science jobs waning?
text:
I don’t personally see any weakening demand for serious data science but I’ve read a few articles stating that:

1. It’s a big company dominated role and the hiring freezes are severally hitting DS head count.

2. It is a luxury role that companies can do without so they are hiring — for example — data analysts instead of data scientists.

3. The role is vacuous and fragmented and the different fragments are starting to fly by their own titles.

This is a question for those with senior level DS experience with research backgrounds. What do you see?

Ask HN: How does a hobby programmer get hired?
text:
I've been tinkering with code since a young age and I like thinking my way through problems and understanding the way computers work, but I've never had a programming job. For the longest time, I went in other directions even though I enjoy it a lot, because I was told that I shouldn't spend my life in front of a computer. It turns out that I do that anyway, just not being paid for it.

Without any programming jobs on my CV, what is a good way to penetrate into the market? I've had job interviews where I did a bunch of coding challenges (and passed), but didn't get accepted because of lack of experience. I considered that maybe I need to do a bootcamp as an initial way to back my skills up.

Ask HN: How do you manage your passwords in 2023?
text:
I have yet to find a password management solution which is:

- secure

- easy to use

- accessible on multiple devices (home PC, work PC, and ideally phone)

I currently use a mixture of KeePassX (synced manually using SSH) and stored passwords (e.g., in my browser). But I keep thinking that there MUST be a better solution.

Ask HN: Co-Founder? Seeking Co-Founder?
text:
Happy New Year HN!

Let's make this new year full of inspiring innovation!

This is the monthly "Co-Founder? Seeking Co-Founder?" post.

It would be great if whoishiring takes over this.

Example:

SEEKING CO-FOUNDER | FinTech | CEO/Sales | US/EU/Worldwide | Pre-Seed

A great idea in the taxation niche, MVP ready to go. Ideally someone with local connections to SMEs.
